intro: Pourouma tomentosa subsp. essequiboensis, commonly known as the Essequibo river bamboo, is a member of the Marantaceae family. It is a clump-forming, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet, tropical environments. The plant features elongated, cylindrical stems covered in a dense layer of fine, white pubescence. Its leaves are large, lance-shaped, and often have a waxy texture. This subspecies is native to the Guianas and is adapted to thrive in humid, low-light conditions.
